text: There's an awful lot packed in three minutes, thirty seconds. It has this sheen of being a breezy kind or song but it runs a heck of a lot deeper when you listen. These guys are all such great musicians at this point they've obliterated the struggle of putting the ideas forth. That's why it sounds so smooth and easygoing, there's no distance between the emotion and the talent to express it. It's automatic.

text:
"Evicted", una elegante y delicada canción es lo nuevo de Wilco. La banda de Chicago liderada por Jeff Tweedy lleva más de veinte años ofreciendo buena música, marcada por el rock y el sonido americano, ahora nos anuncian su nuevo disco, su decimotercer trabajo de estudio, que se va a titular "Cousin" y que lanzarán el próximo 29 de septiembre. Sobre la canción "Evicted" el propio Tweedy ha señalado que "las heridas autoinfligidas todavía duelen y, según mi experiencia, es casi imposible recuperarse por completo de ellas”.
"Cousin" está compuesto por diez nuevas canciones. Adelantan que la escocesa Cate Le Bon (Deerhunter, Kurt Vile), destacada figura del avant-rock y folk europeo, se suma al proyecto. Es probable que alguno de esos temas caigan en las actuaciones por nuestro país que arrancan el próximo 12 de agosto con motivo de la celebración del Sonorama Ribera 2023.
Música independiente novedades.
author: Anselmo Echeverria

text: I was working part time at the five and dime...My boss was Mr. McGee. Prince would be happy to have the chord progression of  his verse ripped off. Great song though!  Wilco is always consistently good.

author: Beefaroni

text: I have no idea how to explain why and how this is suddenly my favorite Wilco song. I just turned 30, and this song speaks to what it's like to be... still displaced at 30. The age they were when they wrote Yankee Hotel Foxtrot. This song speaks to something abstract and universal that can only be explained through... music. This incredible pop song you can't help but nod your head to that is about one of the truest, saddest human realities we all deal with.
author: Nat Klaung

text: Love it! But I'm in tears as I listen, making me think of my soon to be 18 year old firstborn son whom I have not seen in almost 4 years due to familial estrangement. His mother has turned him against me, and it feels like I'll never see him nor his younger brother again.

text: No hate to wilco, but I feel like I've heard this song before. A lot of the new stuff just sounds the same. I love the little flourishes and things that make this song unique, but it doesn't feel new to me. Maybe the rest of the record will be more my speed. Anyways, still a decent song from my favorite band. 🤙
